title: Recycled Carbon-Made Jackets - lululemon Unveils a Jacket Made Partially from Captured Carbon (TrendHunter.com)
text:
lululemon is transforming its production practices by opting for a more sustainable approach. The brand's new Packable Anorak jacket is composed of enzymatically recycled polyester and captured carbon, aligning with the company's goal of shifting to 75% recycled polyester. Furthermore, the brand is dedicated to making 100% of its products "with preferred materials, or those with improved environmental or social sustainability outcomes and impacts compared to conventional production, and end-to-end solutions to advance a circular ecosystem by 2030."
The innovative polyester used in this jacket is created through a blend of advanced bioprocessing technologies. Samsara Eco, a leader in enzymatic recycling, plays a crucial role in this process. Combining this with LanzaTech's captured carbon material, lululemon's Packable Anorak jacket is one of the newest examples of a modern fashion brand putting in substantial effort to create circular products.
